meanings.definition: Of or relating to equal pressure.
meanings.sent1: The weather report mentioned an isobaric system moving in.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted an isobaric experiment to study pressure changes.
meanings.sent3: The isobaric conditions made it easy to predict the storm's path.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was isobaric, never letting the stress affect her.
meanings.sent5: The isobaric chamber maintained a consistent pressure for the test.

meanings.sent1: The isobaric heating system kept the room warm all night.
meanings.sent2: The scuba diver used an isobaric technique to descend slowly.
meanings.sent3: The isobaric tire pressure prevented any flats during the race.
meanings.sent4: His isobaric grip on the steering wheel showed his focus.
meanings.sent5: The isobaric pump ensured a steady flow of liquid in the experiment.

meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points of equal pressure.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist drew an isobaric on the weather map.
meanings.sent2: The pilot followed the isobaric to navigate through the storm.
meanings.sent3: The isobaric on the map looked like a tangled web of lines.
meanings.sent4: The isobaric acted as a guide for ships traveling at sea.
meanings.sent5: The isobaric helped determine the areas of high and low pressure on the map.
